title: Rose Byrne transforms into feminist icon Gloria Steinem in a bouffant wig and paisley mini-dress
text:
She's the Australian actress who recently spoke about the importance of women identifying as feminists.

And Rose Byrne, 40, was in her element as she played 70s feminist icon Gloria Steinem while filming scenes for her upcoming TV series Mrs America in New York on Sunday.

The star looked almost unrecognisable in a bouffant wig and paisley mini-dress as she and her on-screen love interest Jay Ellis held hands and smooched on the sidewalk.

Groovy baby! Rose Byrne, 40, was in her element as she played 70s feminist icon Gloria Steinem while filming scenes with co-star Jay Ellis for her upcoming TV series Mrs America in New York on Sunday

The Sydney-born actress looked the spitting image of a young Gloria as she sashayed in front of the camera in a black fur jacket, platform heels and retro spectacles.

Meanwhile, Jay stepped back in time in a slim-line black suit, blue business shirt and 70s-inspired tie.

During the scene, Rose and Jay were seen arriving at a sidewalk in a retro yellow taxi.

What an entrance! During the scene, Rose and Jay were seen arriving at a sidewalk in a retro yellow taxi before stepping out of the vehicle and sharing a smooch

After stepping out of the old-time vehicle, the couple shared a sweet kiss before proceeding to walk through a buzzing crowd of photographers dressed in period attire.

Mrs America will tell the true story of the movement to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment through the eyes of the feminists involved.

Like her on-screen character, Rose is an outspoken advocate for women's rights, having established all-female production company The Dollhouse Collective in 2015.

Uncanny! The Sydney-born actress looked the spitting image of a young Gloria as she sashayed in front of the camera in a black fur jacket, platform heels and retro spectacles

Speaking to InStyle magazine about equality in May, the Bridesmaids star said: 'If a feminist means to treat and be treated equally, then I am absolutely, 100 per cent a feminist.'

'I just want to be at the table with everybody else - talking about and making the decisions in all parts of life.'

Mrs America will hit screens in 2020 and will feature Australian actress Cate Blanchett in the lead role.
